name: ALN Filter
optimalRetrievalWindow: • Successful retrieval rates up to 100% with mean dwell times of 25.6 months (16)
treatmentOptions: • Routine retrieval with 9Fr ALN removal kit or standard snare via IJ approach
• Complex retrieval may be considered if filter tip is embedded

name: Bard Denali
safetyConsiderations: • Limited data/follow up: Filter penetration rate of 2.3% at retrieval (28)
optimalRetrievalWindow: • Limited data/follow up: 98% success rate with mean indwell time of 136 days, max 454 days (28)
treatmentOptions: • Routine retrieval with dual 9 & 11Fr ID sheaths and intravascular loop snare via IJ approach.
• Complex retrieval may be considered if filter becomes embedded.
specifications: • Sheath size: 8.4Fr ID/10.4Fr OD (J/S), 8.4Fr ID/10.4Fr OD (Fem)

name: Bard Eclipse
safetyConsiderations: • Device fracture - 5-12% (Nicholson Arch Int Med 2010, Vijay JVIR 2012) with estimated prevalence of 38% at 5 years (19)(21)(23)(24)
optimalRetrievalWindow: • Based on G2 data: Successful retrieval rate of 95% within 300 days - mean dwell time of 144 days (25)
treatmentOptions: • Routine retrieval with 10Fr ID Recovery cone via IJ approach
• Complex retrieval may be considered if filter tip is embedded
specifications: • Sheath size: 10Fr ID/12Fr OD (J/S), 7Fr ID/9Fr OD (Fem)

name: Bard G2
safetyConsiderations: • Device fracture: 1.2-12% with estimated prevalence of 38% at 5 years (19)(21)(23)
optimalRetrievalWindow: • Successful retrieval rate of 95% within 300 days - mean dwell time of 144 days (25)
treatmentOptions: • Routine retrieval with 10Fr ID Recovery cone via IJ approach
• Complex retrieval may be considered if filter tip is embedded
specifications: • Sheath size: 10Fr ID/12 Fr OD (J/S), 7Fr ID/9Fr OD (Fem)

name: Bard G2X
safetyConsiderations: • Device fracture: 1.2 - 12% with estimated prevalence of 38% at 5 years (18)(21)(23)(24)
optimalRetrievalWindow: • Based on G2 data: successful retrieval rate of 95% within 300 days - mean dwell time of 144 days (25)
treatmentOptions: • Routine retrieval with 10Fr ID Recovery cone via IJ approach
• Complex retrieval may be considered if filter tip is embedded
specifications: • Sheath size: 10Fr ID/12Fr OD (J/S), 7Fr ID/9Fr OD (Fem)

name: Bard Meridian
safetyConsiderations: • Reports of filter fracture and embolization have been reported in the literature (26)(27)
• Cases of incomplete expansion secondary to crossed limbs have been reported (27)
optimalRetrievalWindow: • Successful retrieval rate of 95% within 300 days - mean dwell time of 144 days (25)
treatmentOptions: • Routine retrieval with 10Fr ID sheath and intravascular loop snare via IJ approach
• Complex retrieval may be considered in the setting of complications
specifications: • Sheath size: 10Fr ID/12Fr OD (J/S), 8Fr ID/10Fr OD (Fem)

name: Bard Recovery
safetyConsiderations: • Device fracture/embolization: 5.5 - 25% with an estimated incidence of 39.5% at 65.7 months (19)(20)(21)(71)
optimalRetrievalWindow: • Successful retrieval rate of 94 - 100% with mean dwell times of 228 - 254 days (22)(23)
treatmentOptions: • Routine retrieval with 10Fr ID Recovery cone via IJ approach
• Complex retrieval may be considered if filter tip is embedded
specifications: • Sheath size: 10Fr ID/12Fr OD (J/S), 7Fr ID/9Fr OD (Fem)

name: Bard Simon Nitinol
optimalRetrievalWindow: • This is a permanent device not FDA-cleared for removal; however retrieval has been reported using complex techniques
treatmentOptions: • Complex retrieval may be considered if removal is desired

name: B. Braun Bena Tech LGM
safetyConsiderations: • High rates of IVC thrombosis/stenosis and occlusion with an occlusion rate of 3.7%/year with IVC patency rates down to 67% at 9 years follow up (33)
optimalRetrievalWindow: • This is a permanent device not FDA-cleared for removal; however retrieval has been reported using complex techniques
treatmentOptions: • Complex retrieval may be considered if removal is desired

name: B. Braun Vena Tech LP
safetyConsiderations: • Incomplete opening on deployment leading to migration/embolization in some cases (35)
optimalRetrievalWindow: • This is a permanent device not FDA-cleared for removal; however retrieval has been reported using complex techniques
treatmentOptions: • Complex retrieval may be considered if removal is desired

name: Boston Scientific 12 Fr Stainless Greenfield
optimalRetrievalWindow: • This is a permanent device not FDA-cleared for removal; however retrieval has been reported using complex techniques
treatmentOptions: • Complex retrieval may be considered if removal is desired

name: Boston Scientific 24 Fr Stainless Greenfield
optimalRetrievalWindow: • This is a permanent device not FDA-cleared for removal; however retrieval may be possible using complex techniques
treatmentOptions: • Complex retrieval may be considered if removal is desired
specifications: • Route: Fem, R Jug usually via cut-down, altough percutaneous placement was reported (44)

name: Boston Scientific Titanium Greenfield
safetyConsiderations: • Penetration: 13 - 50% prior to hook modification, 1% with MH design (40)(68)
optimalRetrievalWindow: • This is a permanent device not FDA-cleared for removal, however retrieval has been reported using complex techniques
treatmentOptions: • Complex retrieval may be considered if removal is desired

name: Cook Bird's Nest
optimalRetrievalWindow: • This is a permanent device not FDA-cleared for removal
treatmentOptions: • If removal is indicated, complex percutaneous or surgical retrieval may be considered
specifications: • Sheath size: 12Fr ID/14Fr OD (J), 12Fr ID/14Fr OD (Fem) - Placed through 14Fr sheath

name: Cook Celect
safetyConsiderations: • Caval perforation - 49 - 93% with mean follow up of 152 and 277 days (49)(50)
• Incidence of perforation increases with longer dwell time (50)
optimalRetrievalWindow: 50 weeks - reported success rate of 100% within this window (52)
treatmentOptions: • Routine retrieval with 11Fr retrieval set via IJ approach
• Complex retrieval may be considered if filter is embedded
specifications: • Sheath size: 7Fr ID/9Fr OD (J), 8.5Fr ID/10Fr OD (Fem)

name: Cook Gunther Tulip
safetyConsiderations: • Caval perforation: 43 - 78% with mean follow up of 247 and 437 days (49)(50)
• Incidence of perforation increases with longer dwell time (50)
optimalRetrievalWindow: • 4 - 12 weeks - reported success rates of 99% at 4 weeks and 94% at 12 weeks (51)
treatmentOptions: • Routine retrieval with 9 - 11FR sheaths via IJ approach
• Complex retrieval may be considered if filter is embedded
specifications: • Sheath Size: 7Fr ID/9Fr OD (J), 8.5Fr ID/10Fr OD (Fem)

name: Cordis Optease
safetyConsiderations: • Symptomatic caval thrombosis in up to 1.4% (54)
• Increasingly difficult retrieval with prolonged dwell times (55)(56)
• Fracture rates up to 50% have been reported with the Trapease device at mean follow up of 50 months (57)
optimalRetrievalWindow: • Optimal dwell time of 12 days
• Within 60 days (55)
treatmentOptions: • Routine retrieval via femoral approach
• Complex retrieval may be considered if filter is embedded

name: Cordis Trapease
safetyConsiderations: • Fracture: up to 50% at mean follow up of 50 months (57)
• Symptomatic IVC/Iliac vein thrombosis in up to 6.9% (58)
optimalRetrievalWindow: • This is a permanent device not FDA-cleared for removal; however retrieval has been reported using complex techniques
treatmentOptions: • Complex retrieval may be considered if filter is embedded

name: Rafael Safe Flo
optimalRetrievalWindow: • This was approved as a permanent device in the US and an optional device in Europe
treatmentOptions: • Routine retrieval via same site as placement

name: Rex Medical Option
safetyConsiderations: • Tilting (>15 degrees) at time of retrieval: 7.7% (59)
optimalRetrievalWindow: • 92.3% retrieval rate at a mean dwell time of 67.1 days (range, 1-175 d) (59)
treatmentOptions: • Routine retrieval via IJ approach
• Complex retrieval may be considered if the filter is embedded

name: Volcano Crux
safetyConsiderations: 9.6% reported rate of recurrent VTE and 1.6% reported rate of technical failure during deployment in the RETRIEVE trail (48)
optimalRetrievalWindow: • 98.1% retrieval success rate with a mean retrieval time of 84.6 days (48)
treatmentOptions: • Bidirectional deployment and retrieval
• Routine retrieval via a jugular or femoral approach with a two-sheath coaxial system (6F inner sheath, 10F outer sheath) with a snare device is recommended, but not required
• Limited data is available
